title.narrative: Decentralization and Local Government Strengthening II
Descentralización y Fortalecimiento del Gobierno Municipal II

description.narrative: Continuar apoyando a los gobiernos locales de Suriname a los esfuerzos de descentralización que se empezaron desde 2001. Particularmente, apoyar a gobiernos locales de Paramaribo, Sipalliwini, Saramacca, Coronie, y Brokopondo, de manera que obtengan una marco legal base y una relevante capacidad institucional para auto administrarse. Inclusive, la DLGS-II también asistirá a distritos certificados de Wanica, Para, Nickerie, Commewijne, y Marowijne en la implementación de servicios locales y proyectos de inversión de infraestructura.

To continue supporting Suriname's local government's decentralization efforts that commenced back in 2001. Specially, assisting local governments in Paramaribo, Sipaliwini, Saramacca, Coronie, and Brokopondo attain a core legal framework and relevant institutional capacity for fiscal self-management. Furthermore, the DLGS-II will also assist certified districts of Wanica, Para, Nickerie, Commewijne, and Marowijne in the implementation of local services and infrastructure investment projects.

activity-description.narrative: For each investment project, a neighborhood committee has been set up by the Local Government. The purpose of the committee is to involve citizens in the social monitoring and validation of projects. These groups consist of direct beneficiaries of the investment in their neighborhood. The citizens volunteer their time by mobilizing their fellows in getting buy in for the project, taking care for safety during the project execution and monitoring the quality of the project

The District Administrator of Brokopondo is receiving hands–on training in the financial software administration system OpenERP. The loan also financed the office equipment and software required to adequately perform their tasks

The loan financed local servers at the district level. Through the installation and maintenance of district local servers, all the districts are connected to Central Government via a Wide Area Network, facilitating the harmonization of financial systems administration and data transfer.

The loan financed local servers at the district level. Through the installation and maintenance of district local servers, all the districts are connected to Central Government via a Wide Area Network, facilitating the harmonization of financial systems administration and data transfer.

The program invested in roads and drainage by managing basic infrastructure projects and services in Suriname for institutional capacity at district level. District Marowijne was selected by the resort and district council to pilot the concrete drainage element nearby a primary school. This method was implemented to reduce the maintenance costs in comparison with mowing the grass frequently. The concrete construction also provides a sidewalk for the community, in particular the students
